prospects.title: Backend Developer 2
prospects.description:
Looking for self-starting engineers with strong experience developing sophisticated applications on the iPhone or iPad using the iOS SDK.
If you're interested in joining a team of passionate, extremely talented industry veterans in the mobile space, who like to work hard and play hard, we look forward to hearing from you soon!
prospects.details:
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS 
- Extensive knowledge of object-oriented software development
- Experience building complex applications for the iPhone or iPad using Objective-C / C++ with Cocoa and other frameworks
- Mobile application development at the user interface and system levels
- Ability to understand and debug large and complex code bases
- Experience designing clean and maintainable APIs
- Experience with multithreaded programming
- Experience writing unit tests and testable code

prospects.title: Junior Developer 3
prospects.description:
As a junior developer you will work with a team to help create the software and websites that enable brands to thrive. You will be exposed to new technologies and will help craft modern websites and to showcase how customers interact with the brands they care about.

Qualifications:

A technical degree, certificate or equivalent experience
Experience developing software and/or web applications
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to think outside the box and adapt to change
prospects.details:
Required Technologies

PHP
HTML5
CSS/SCSS
JavaScript/ECMA Script
At least a basic understanding of SQL and Databases
Version control technology such as GIT

Nice to haves:

Experience working with WordPress and/or Drupal
Experience with ASP.NET
Experience with Laravel and/or CodeIgniter
Experience with Mobile Technologies such as Xamarin, Android, Kotlin and Swift
Experience with Vagrant
Experience with React.js, Vue.js or Angular.js

Perks

Flexible PTO
401k program
Full Medical

events.title: Phone Interview with Monica(HR)
events.details: Now choose the library that pickers will use to work with date. We are providing interfaces for moment, luxon and date-fns. If you are not using moment in the project (or dont have it in the bundle already) we suggest using date-fns or luxon, because they are much lighter and will be correctly tree-shaked from the bundle. Note, that we support only the 2.0.0-alpha.16 version of date-fns for now. Stay tuned!
events.nextstep: Waiting for response from Monica about next steps
